Data.Title: Gotta + vb
Data.Description: Gotta + vb - something has to be done.
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Gotta + verb: </color><color=#c9e8ff>  Got to. It's grammaticaly incorrect, It uses in speaking form.</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Have gotta + verb: </color><color=#c9e8ff>It means the same but is slyghly different form gotta. It means Something has to be done in near future.</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:I gotta move to a bigger house.
R01:He's gotta be good at something.Everybody is good at something.
R01:I gotta brush my teeth.
R01:You gotta tell him you need sleep.
R02:I’ve gotta try harder at school.
R02:I’ve gotta tell my wife I’ll be late.
R02:I've gotta go get ready.
R02:It's gotta be well past midnight!
SpanishExamples: Tengo que mudarme a una casa más grande
Tiene que ser bueno en algo. Todo el mundo es bueno en algo.
Tienes que decirle que necesitas dormir.
Tengo que estudiar más en el colegio.
Tengo que decirle a mi mujer que llegaré tarde.
Tendrá que estar bien pasada la media noche.

Data.Title: Gonna + vb
Data.Description: Gonna + vb - something will be done in the future
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Gonna + verb: </color><color=#c9e8ff>  Going to. It's grammaticaly incorrect, It uses in speaking form.</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:I'm gonna have some coffee.
R01:I'm gonna run a marathon.
R01:I'm gonna ask her out for dinner.
R01:I'm gonna take swim lessons.
SpanishExamples: Voy a pedirla salir a cenar.
Voy a tomar clases de natación

Data.Title: Mean
Data.Description: Mean or Not Mean - Intención, Querer decir
Rules: R02:<color=#5bd3de>Not mean: </color><color=#c9e8ff>No tener intención de hacer algo</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:What do you mean?
R01:I mean it, he is very mean.
R01:I mean, I swear!
R01:What does the word 'available' mean?
R02:I didn't mean to do that.
R02:I didn't mean to hurt your feelings.
R02:I didn't mean to embarrass you.
R02:I didn't mean to lie about what happened.
SpanishExamples: Lo digo en serio, es muy malo.
No tenía la intención de hacer eso
No tenía la intención de herir tus sentimientos
No tenía la intención de avengonzarte.
No quería mentirte sobre lo que pasó.

Data.Title: Wanna + vb
Data.Description: Wanna + vb - Help to communicate something you want to do.
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>Wanna + verb: </color><color=#c9e8ff>  Want to. It's grammaticaly incorrect, It uses in speaking form.</color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Don't wanna + verb: </color><color=#c9e8ff>It's the opposite of want to - don't want to do something.</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:I wanna talk.
R01:I wanna search for a job.
R01:I wanna order some food.
R01:I wanna marry him.
R02:I don't wanna talk.
R02:I don't wanna marry her.
R02:I don't wanna listen to that song.
R02:I don't wanna order some food.
